definition: to sauté/to stir-fry/to speculate/to hype/to fire (sb)

sentences.english: Here is your fried rice with egg, sir.
This generous wine feels softer when paired with the Sautéed Rice with Seafood and Thailand Shrimp Paste.

sentences.english: Magda: Yeah, have you tried the fried rice? It's really spicy.
sentences.chinese: 是呀，你有沒有喫那種炒飯？真的好辣哦。

sentences.english: We have Yangzhou fried rice in Chinese restaurants back in the U. K.

sentences.english: I will do is the ability tasty Egg Fried Rice.

sentences.english: If you are in a hurry, I would recommend fried rice noodles or shredded chicken fired rice.
sentences.chinese: 如果您趕時間，我建議您來個炒米粉或雞肉碎炒飯。

sentences.english: Can we have two plain steamed rice and one fried rice, please?
sentences.chinese: 我們可以要兩份白米飯和一份炒飯嗎？

sentences.english: Common English: I studied to make rice and boil vegetable soup.

sentences.english: That's two boiled and one fried.
sentences.chinese: 兩份白米飯和一份炒飯。

sentences.english: I would like an Egg Fried Rice.

sentences.english: Why don't have some fried rice?The shrimp fried rice at this restaurant is really delicious.

sentences.english: Traditional Indonesian fried rice with beef satay, chicken wing and prawn crackers, topped with fried egg.

sentences.english: I learned how to cook fried rice from this cookbook.
sentences.chinese: 我靠着這本食譜學會作炒飯。

sentences.english: I would like some fried rice and a glass of iced lemon tea.
sentences.chinese: 我想要點炒飯和一杯冰的檸檬紅茶。
